metadata.title: CVE-2024-0584 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free issue was found in igmp_start_timer in net/ipv4/igmp.c inthe network sub-component in the Linux Kernel. This flaw allows a localuser to observe a refcnt use-after-free issue when receiving an igmp querypacket, leading to a kernel information leak.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-0584` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-250.284
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-250.284
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-250.284
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-221.232~16.04.1
